metadata.title: CVE-2018-16393 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Several buffer overflows when handling responses from a Gemsafe V1Smartcard in gemsafe_get_cert_len in libopensc/pkcs15-gemsafeV1.c in OpenSCbefore 0.19.0-rc1 could be used by attackers able to supply craftedsmartcards to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

opensc - 0.19.0-1build1
opensc-pkcs11 - 0.19.0-1build1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: opensc package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.19.0-1build1').
